description.narrative: Comprehensive reduction and elimination of Persistent Organic Pollutants in Pakistan

activity-description.narrative: Prevent the release of persistent organic pollutants pesticides into the environment due to improper storage and climatic conditions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
1.1: Number of regulatory tools and policy frameworks relevant to the management of POPs including PCBs, hazardous waste pesticides strengthened and updated. [Scale: 0 = No legislation; Scale 1 = One (01) POPs related national legislation] 1.2: Extent to which national Technical POPs management Guidelines compliant with SC developed and effectively implemented. [Scale: 1= No national Technical POPs management Guidelines (0%); 2= National Technical POPs management Guidelines established, but not being effectively implemented (up to 20%); 3= National Technical POPs management Guidelines established, and partially implemented (51-85%); 4= Mechanism well-established and fully implemented (100%)]
1.3: Availability of an updated chemical profile report for Pakistan [Scale: 0= No Profile; 1= Updated Profile Report ]
2.1: Extent to which main custom offices (provincial & national level) out of the total number which has adopted procedures and circulars establishing POPs management and enforcement [Scale: 1= No Custom Officer trained in adopting procedure and circulars establishing POPs Management (0%); 2= Some Custom Officers trained in adopting procedure and circulars establishing POPs Management, but not being effectively implemented (upto 20%); 3= Custom Officers trained in adopting procedure and circulars establishing POPs Management and partially implemented (51-85%); 4= All Custom Officers trained in adopting procedure and circulars establishing POPs Management and fully implemented (100%)]
3.1: Extent to which institutes and communities demonstrate through their practices/behavior enhanced awareness on POPs [Scale: 1= No relevant Institute and community trained on POPs exposure (0%); 2= Some relevant Institutes and communities trained on POPs exposure (upto 20%); 3= Majority of relevant Institutes and communities trained on POPs exposure ((21-50%); 4= All Communities but partial institutions trained on POPs exposure (51- 80 %); 5= All Communities and instituti

comment.narrative:
1.1: 0 [Desc: The initial POPs pesticides as included in the Stockholm Convention before 2009 are banned in Pakistan, through the Agricultural Pesticides Ordinance, 1971. New POPs like PFOs and brominate flame retardants are not regulated in Pakistan.A PCBs regulation is completely missing. Regulation on U-POPs emission is not compliant with the SC BAT/BEP.]
1.2: scale 1 [No national Technical POPs management Guidelines]. 1.3: 0 [Desc: Chemical Profile for the country was completed in 2009 by the International Cooperation Wing of the former Ministry of Environment.. The chemical profile includes description of the chemical management in the country, including regulatory framework and management of hazardous waste, which will obviously need to be updated as a result of the activity of the project]
2.1: Scale 1 [Desc.: Inadequate awareness of importers and custom officers on imports requirements; Inadequate POPs inspectorate services Lack of control on the export of PCB content of end of life electrical equipment.]
3.1: Scale 1 [Desc.: Inadequate resources for dissemination of information on the viable POPs alternatives]
4.1: Scale 1 [Desc.: Lack of guidelines on risk minimization procedures for handling, transportation, storage and disposal of PCB contaminated equipment. Lack of adequate legal provision for monitoring of POPs release and their effects to human environment; There are no legal provisions focusing on PCBs management.]
5.1: Scale 1 [Desc.: Lack of awareness, both for the public at large, decision makers or farmers, on public awareness on health and environmental risks associated with POP pesticides.]
6.1: 0 % [Desc: The National Implementation Plan (NIP) for POPs, inventories approximately 6,031 MT of obsolete stocks of POPs pesticides in 430 identified sites. Of these 3,800 MT are in Punjab

1.1: [Formulation of One (01) POPs related national legislation, administrative rules, legislative framework and implementation]. 1.2: Scale 3: [National Technical POPs management Guidelines established, and partially implemented (51%-75%)]. 1.3: 1 updated profile [Availability of an updated chemical profile report for Pakistan]. 2.1:Scale 4. All Custom Officers and relevant departments fully trained in adopting and enforcing POPs management procedures (100%). 3.1: No target planned 4.1: No target planned 5.1: Scale 3: No target planned 6.1: 100% [inventory of 5000 equipment] 6.2: Scale 1 [5000 equipment tested] 6.3: 100% [All relevant institutions and laboratories trained on sampling, analysis and labeling of PCB contaminated (100%).] 6.4: No target planned 7.1: 850 MT [(all available stockpiles) destruction ] 7.2: 350 MT [PCBs Oil disposal or treatment through technology] 8.1: No target planned

1.1: 1 [E3:E13 management, formulation of Operation rules, SROs at national and provincial level , development of action plan for POPs control and legislative framework implementation will be done.] 1.2: Scale 2 [Formulation of national technical guidelines on POPs management and control has been initiated] 1.3: 1 updated profile [Availability of an updated chemical profile report for Pakistan]. 2.1: Scale 3 [International Conference on POPs enforcement tools (sustainable south-south cooperation) in Islamabad and stake-holder Consultation on POPs governance mechanism and imports policy framework in context of POPs in all provinces are already planned.] 3.1: Scale 2 [The project has already developed a training manual and shall provide on-site trainings to grass root level workers in the power and industrial sector, including farmer communities. The project has used in-kind support from government departments for logistics and venue of these trainings. 13 number of onsit trainings were being conducted within spaces/conference halls of relevant government departments. All communities but partial institutions are already trained] 4.1: 0 [Project has organized PCBs trainings for power generation/distribution companies on PCBs management. Four trainings on PCBs for the staff of the power generation companies in Lahore, Islamabad, Multan and Karachi were conducted. 151 officials attended these trainings out of which 138 were men and 13 were women. Participants were mostly from the Energy (electric power) sector, other relevant stakeholders including Environment Protection Agencies and National Electric Power Regulatory Authority (NEPRA)] 5.1: Scale 3 [More than 30 government departments at district/provincial level and institutions have received 6 number of training sessions on POPs exposure. For now, project has target communities through disseminating knowledge material i.e. animated/Urdu short documentaries, brochures and flyers.Project has delivered on-site trainings for root level workers including farmers and communities in September 2019. Most of the target groups have been trained] 6.1: 50% [The project engaged four laboratories in 2019 to collect & analyze 2000 samples from all provinces and a national consultant to compile this information which is required for the development of the PCBs inventory. Testing of remaining 3000 samples is on way] 6.2: Scale 0 [The project has engaged four laboratories to collect & analyze 2000 samples from all provinces and a national consultant to compile this information which is required for the development of the PCBs inventory. Testing of additional 3000 samples is on way] 6.3: Scale 3 [Identification of POPs and PCBs at EPA and DISCOs/Energy Departments level through provision of equipment and training is in process.] 7.1: 443 [Project has already disposed of 443 MT of POPs Pesticides, Transport and disposal of 286 MT of POPs Pesticides and additional amount of contaminated soil will be destroyed. Project will also work on safe disposal of incineration ash, bioremediation of contaminated soil and deposition of chemicals on vegetation covers in Punjab.] 7.2: 350 MT [Transport and disposal of 350 MT of PCBs contaminated oil and treatment through procurement technology is planned, health assessment of workers will also be done.] 8.1: 0 [Development of PCBs management plan is already in process]

1.1: 1 [(One POPs related national legislation and its implementation plan updated and amended)] 1.2: Scale 3 [National Technical POPs management Guidelines established, and partially implemented (51%-75%)] 1.3: No target planned 2.1: Scale 4 [All Custom Officers trained in adopting procedure and circulars establishing POPs] 3.1: No target Planned 4.1: No target Planned 5.1: No target planned 6.1: 100% [National Inventory of POPs stockpile upgraded, including map for identifying priority sites] 6.2: Scale 1[5000PCBs tested, sampling and testing of 3000 equipment contaminated with PCBs (2000 already tested) 6.3: Scale 5[All labs trained on analysis, Identification of POPs at EPA level, provision of GCMS equipment for upgradation of national labs and trainings] 6.4: No target planned 7.1: 850 ( 850 MT pesticides stockpiles disposed off) 7.2: 75 tons [Up to 75 tons. PCBs contaminated equipment/ oil safely destructed] 8.1: Scale 1 [National level management scheme for POPs pesticides and management plan for PCBs will be finalised]

1.1: 1 {Final draft rules on POPs management have been developed. Summary to add Stockholm convention into Pakistan Environment Protection Act (PEPA) along with the draft rules have been moved to Prime Minister office for further approval} National technical POPs management guidelines (sector-specific)have been developed & shared. 1.2: Scale 3 [National technical guidelines on POPs management and control has been developed] 1.3: No target planned 2.1: Scale 4 [main locations i.e. Islamabad and Karachi. For enactment of regulatory framework, custom officers and managers were also part of consultative workshops on legislation] 3.1: Scale 5 [Last round of consultative workshops held on POPs management and control. GCMS equipment training held to enhance institutional capacity.] 4.1: Scale 4 [Draft National PCBs Management Plan has been developed and shared with all the relevant power sector departments and other relevant stakeholders.] 5.1: No target planned 6.1: 100% [Inventory of PCBs completed by extensive sampling & testing of 5000 samples from power sector. GCMS procured & installed at all EPAs in Pakistan. ] 6.2: Scale 1 [5000Sampling and testing of 5000 PCBs equipment has been completed] 6.3: Scale 5 [Identification of POPs and PCBs at EPA and DISCOs/Energy Departments level through provision and installation of 06 equipment, Gas Chromatograph Mass Spectrometer has been completed. Consumables for GCMS equipment have been delivered.] 6.4: No target planned 7.1: 779 [779 Project has already disposed of 443 MT of POPs Pesticides, Transport and disposal of remaining 286 MT of POPs Pesticides and additional amount of contaminated soil is in progress out of which 50MT has been disposed off] 7.2: 75 tons [Transport and disposal of 350 MT of PCBs contaminated oil will be initiated after the procurement of PCBs free oil as replacement for contaminated oil] 8.1: Scale 1 [PCBs management plan at national level has been developed]
Project closed on Dec 31, 2021. No target planned for 2021
Project closed on Dec 31, 2021. No target planned for 2021
